statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Holy Cross beats Sacred Heart in 122-118 double OT
article.headline: Holy Cross beats Sacred Heart in 122-118 double OT
article.linkText: Holy Cross beats Sacred Heart in 122-118 double OT
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. -- Cullen Hamilton scored a career-high 35 points to lead Holy Cross to a 122-118 double overtime win over Sacred Heart on Wednesday night. Hamilton, who was of 11 of 21 from the field, drained seven 3-pointers for the Crusaders (1-1). Dave Dudzinski delivered a double-double with 26 points, including the free throw at the end of regulation to send the game into its first overtime, and 15 rebounds. Malachi Alexander joined them in double digits with 23 points. Evan Kelley scored 32 points and hauled in eight rebounds for Sacred Heart (0-2), while Steve Glowiak added 28 points, including 7 of 9 from beyond the arc. Holy Cross set a Patriot League record for points in a game, breaking a mark of 116 that the Crusaders set back in 1992. Three other PL teams, Boston U., Bucknell and Navy, scored 90-plus points Wednesday night in victories.
